cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.current_location: about 185 miles (295 km) west of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast toward Bermuda, then forecast to turn east and move away over the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Bermuda (closest passage – not an outright landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None – only Bermuda is under a watch/warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for Bermuda
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bermuda and surrounding western-Atlantic waters; no direct impact expected for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only occasional peripheral breezes under 25 kt possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: None significant; bands remain well north of Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Moderate rip-current risk along north-facing beaches, otherwise minimal operational impact.
